chargeHist.descr: Remove Vehicle's Major Parts w/o Consent
Remove Vehicle's Major Parts w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas C Koutsios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Remove Vehicle's Major Parts w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Concurrent with: any other probation

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, Random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Inform agent of all prescriptions

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent

No contact with any businesses involved in the removal of the vehicle parts or victims listed in the complaint

Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling

Cash bail previously posted in 21CF1866 applied. Court costs and DNA surcharge paid in full. Balance to be refunded to poster.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Nicholas C Koutsios in court, in custody (OTP'd From HOC).  
Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Nicholas C Koutsios.  
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as read in.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING FIREARM AND VOTING RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 Years, 1 Month.
Initial Confinement: 13 Months
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  21CF1866
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation:  4 Years.
Concurrent to any other probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any the businesses involved in the removal of the Vehicle Parts or vicitms listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

CONDITION TIME:
6 Month Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow to be served in the House of Corrections.
Court will not authorize Electronic Monitoring.
Consecutive to his current sentence being served at House of Corrections.


COSTS:  $ 268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail from 21CF1866 and any balance can be refunded to the poster..

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED TO HOC.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:11 AM Attorney Steven Hughes in court.   Defendant Nicholas C Koutsios did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Hughes states that his client was recently sentenced on Milwaukee County Case 21CF4583, and asks to set a plea/sentencing hearing.
Atty Hughes asks to have the Defendant produced by 09/19/2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas C Koutsios
Current: 8885 S 68th St, c/o Milwaukee County House of Correction, Franklin, WI 53132 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2022)
Prior: 1620 W Wind Lake, Milwaukee, WI 53215

09:56 AM Defendant Nicholas C Koutsios in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Detective Arulio Serrano sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Thompson.  Cross examination by Attorney Hughes.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Hughes objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
